intro: Selinum filicaule, commonly known as the fern-leaved selenium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and sagebrush habitats. Selinum filicaule is used in traditional medicine for its purported detoxifying properties.
